title: Use Log Rules
speech: We know that  n times the log base a of b is equal to the log base a of, parentheses b to the n-th  . , 3 times the log base 6 of x is equal to the log base 6 of, parentheses x cubed

title: Match Bases and Solve for $$x$$
text: Since $$3*\log_{6}\left(x\right)=\log_{6}\left(x^3\right)=\log_{6}\left(64\right)$$ have the same bases both sides, we can take out the logarithm and get $$x^3=64$$. Solve for $$x^3=64$$ which gives $$x=4$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. $$4$$ is non negative. Therefore $$x=4$$ is the only solution for this equation.
speech: Since  3 times the log base 6 of x is equal to the log base 6 of, parentheses x cubed  is equal to, the log base 6 of 64,  have the same bases both sides, we can take out the logarithm and get  x cubed is equal to, 64 . Solve for  x cubed, is equal to 64  which gives  x, is equal to 4 . Given  the log base a of b, ,  b  can not be negative.  4  is non negative. Therefore  x is equal to 4  is the only solution for this equation.
